title: Digital Simulation-Based Communication Learning Design for Medical Language Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience, proficiency in basic medical terminology and document comprehension
context.additional_context: A practical-oriented training program for medical document translators and communication specialists, focusing on acquiring specialized vocabulary and improving accuracy in situational expressions.

learning_goals: Enhancing proficiency in analyzing patient records and using specialized terminology in clinical scenarios via medical simulation tools.
Reducing error rates by 30% through improved accuracy in medical terminology and situational language expressions in digital learning environments.
Demonstrating complex problem-solving skills similar to real-world medical settings and strengthening professional communication abilities through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
